definition: to supervise and urge completion of a task/to urge on

sentences.english: Mothers-in-law hasten sons-in-law to buy houses, thus they may assure before their daughters getting married.
sentences.chinese: 丈母娘督促小女婿快点买房，这样才放心嫁女儿。

sentences.english: It urged the authorities to stop the fascist oppressive rule.
sentences.chinese: 该声明督促现当局停止法西斯的压迫统治。

sentences.english: There is no need for a congressional prod.
sentences.chinese: 国会的督促并没有必要。

sentences.english: Johnson urged politicians to increase sentences for people found guilty of gun crimes.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊督促政治家提高对被判犯有枪支罪者的刑期。

sentences.english: To strengthen supervision and inspection, strict enforcement of law and discipline.
sentences.chinese: 要加强督促检查，严格执法执纪。

sentences.english: I"ll get after them to work three shifts to step up production."
sentences.chinese: 我会督促工厂采用三班倒的形式来增加生产。

sentences.english: Does she need to remind Mr Chiam to eat his medicine regularly?
sentences.chinese: 那她需要督促他定时吃药吗？

sentences.english: To supervise the self-examination and periodically service industry.
sentences.chinese: 还要督促服务行业定期开展自查和整改。

sentences.english: They would also allow voters to hold presidents accountable for the quality of justices they nominate.
sentences.chinese: 这亦使选民们能督促总统为所提名的大法官素质负责。

sentences.english: The party has also urged that the city's legislature vote to strip him from his mayoral post.
sentences.chinese: 中共山西省委还督促市人大投票解除他的市长职务。

sentences.english: I will indicate the manage office improve it…
sentences.chinese: 业委会能督促管理处尽快改进吗？

sentences.english: This time he has been personally supervise the crew to Ling Hong Kong investment plan.
sentences.chinese: 这段时间他一直亲自督促手下做去岭港投资计划书。

sentences.english: He swam several lengths, pushed along by Daisy's urgent quacking.
sentences.chinese: 在黛西呷呷的督促声中，他在浴盆里来回游了好几趟。

sentences.english: Parents please remind your children to finish their holiday homework during the holiday.
sentences.chinese: 借此恳请家长督促学生务必完成指定的假期作业。

sentences.english: Fifth, we must strengthen supervision and oversight and improve the accountability mechanism in order to seriously put it into practice.
sentences.chinese: 五要加强督促检查，完善问责机制，严肃责任追究。

sentences.english: Democratic election urges officials to keep honest.
sentences.chinese: 民主选举，有利于督促干部保持清正廉洁。

definition: to fulfill (one's obligations)/to carry out (a task)/to implement (an agreement)/to perform
to order/to enjoin/to charge/to instruct sb to finish sth
to correct/to amend/to put right/correction/CL:個|个[ge4]
to tidy up/to reorganize/to consolidate/to rectify
